channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pink scooter in middle of pavement, 7th September
item.description:
Print e-scooter left in middle of pavement. This is happening frequently in this location.

item.title: 2 tents and items from camping abandoned. One tent has been burnt the other is collapsed., 7th September
item.description:
Noone is returning to collect this rubbish and it presents a clear hazard to people and animals as there may be sharp objects including needles and there may be gas bottles near a gas stove. Photo won't upload on mobile, android.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince Regent Avenue, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing is broken, 7th September
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing is broken since 8pm last night and is constantly activated. The crossing is turning the lights red and beeping every 30 seconds.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne Way, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double yellow lines, 7th September
item.description:
The lines appear to have been abandoned. They have faded on all sections of this road. Are they in force anymore? If so they are in urgent need of repainting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4a-4h, Banyard Close, Golden Valley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Damaged and missing, 7th September
item.description:
The pavement has crumbled on both sides of the rail way bridge. One side has been blocked off. It the other side has also missing sections of tarmac that are a trip hazard. The barriers have also been abandoned. Both sides are in need of urgent repairs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Sunken manhole, 7th September
item.description:
Manhole by bridge has sunk and car cause loud bang late at night when they drive over. This is dangerous to drive over as it is a heavy veh6riute for buses and lorries.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 107, Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road surface around the roundabout is so badly broken it’s dangerous to cycle around., 7th September

item.title: Large amount of broken glass, 6th September
item.description:
Have reported this before but it is a lot worse. Loads of broken glass near the bar up from the Miller. All over pavement and in gutter. A human or animal could be badly injured. Please sort this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Bath Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain outside Parkway completely blocked, 6th September
item.description:
The drain directly outside Parkway is completely blocked with thick mud and mulch. Causing significant flooding every time it rains. Recurring issue. Needs to be regularly cleared. Renders pavement completely unusable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Benhall Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Unstable Flagstobne outside 76 Promenade, 6th September
item.description:
Outside 76 Promenade is an unstable flagstone. I have witnessed 3 falls within the last month on that very stone & a further atleast 5 in the last year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Promenade, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Idiots painting road signs on roundabout signage, 6th September
item.description:
